[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [TypeTag: Validation] [Malformed Types] Does the system validate that key_type and value_type are well-formed TypeTags before storing in TableInfo, or can malformed types cause VM panics during table access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Hash: TableHandle] [HashMap Poisoning] Can an attacker craft TableHandles with specific hash values to cause worst-case O(n) HashMap lookup performance, degrading validator performance below liveness thresholds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Hash: TableInfo] [Hash DoS] Does TableInfo's derived Hash implementation protect against hash flooding attacks where attacker creates many TableInfos with colliding hash values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Eq: TableHandle] [Substitution Attack] Can two TableHandles with identical AccountAddress values but different provenance (malicious vs. legitimate) be incorrectly treated as equivalent, bypassing access controls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Fuzzing: Arbitrary] [Invalid Generation] Does the proptest_derive::Arbitrary derivation at line 12 generate truly arbitrary TableHandles, or are there constrained values that could reveal edge cases in production? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Fuzzing: TableInfo] [Property Violation] Can the Arbitrary derivation for TableInfo at line 43 generate type combinations that violate Move's type system invariants, revealing bugs in type validation logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [API: from_str()] [Injection Attack] Can special characters or escape sequences in the string passed to from_str() bypass parsing validation and inject malicious AccountAddress values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [API: Parsing Error] [Error Information Leak] Does the AccountAddressParseError returned by from_str() leak sensitive information about internal state or table structure that aids attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Memory: size()] [Calculation Accuracy] Does size() at line 16-18 accurately represent the memory footprint of TableHandle, or does it underestimate heap allocations leading to OOM conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Memory: Clone] [Deep Copy Safety] Does the derived Clone implementation perform deep copies of all fields, or can shallow copies lead to aliasing bugs when TableHandles are duplicated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Resource: TableInfo Clone] [Expensive Operation] Can repeatedly cloning large TableInfo instances (with complex TypeTags) cause memory exhaustion or performance degradation during transaction processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Consensus: Serialization] [Determinism Violation] Do all validators serialize TableHandle identically under all conditions, or can platform differences (endianness, padding) cause state root divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Consensus: TableInfo Ordering] [Sort Inconsistency] When TableInfo instances are sorted for Merkle tree construction, do the Ord/PartialOrd implementations guarantee identical ordering across all validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Consensus: Hash Determinism] [Platform Differences] Does the Hash derivation produce identical hash values on different CPU architectures and Rust compiler versions, or could it cause consensus splits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [State: Handle Creation] [Uniqueness Guarantee] Is there any validation ensuring TableHandles are globally unique across all tables, or can handle collisions occur under specific transaction patterns? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [State: Info Updates] [Mutation Safety] Can TableInfo be modified after table creation, and if so, are there safeguards preventing type changes that violate existing table data invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [State: Deletion] [Cleanup Completeness] When a table is deleted, is the TableInfo properly removed from all caches and indices, or can stale metadata cause access to deleted table data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Conversion: From Trait] [Unsafe Casting] Do the From trait implementations at lines 30-40 perform any validation of the source TableHandle, or can they blindly convert invalid handles? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Conversion: Bidirectional] [Round-trip Safety] Can a TableHandle be converted to move_table_extension::TableHandle and back without losing information or security properties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Concurrency: TableHandle] [Send/Sync Safety] Is TableHandle safely Send+Sync for concurrent access across threads, or can data races occur when multiple threads access the same handle? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Concurrency: TableInfo] [Metadata Races] Can concurrent reads/writes to TableInfo from different transactions cause race conditions that corrupt type metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Arithmetic: size()] [Overflow Risk] Could size() overflow when computing aggregate sizes for large numbers of TableHandles in batch operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Arithmetic: AccountAddress] [Numeric Manipulation] Can the underlying AccountAddress numeric value be manipulated to cause arithmetic errors in table indexing or lookup operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Debug: Trait Derivation] [Behavioral Differences] Do the conditional derives (#[cfg_attr]) at lines 12 and 43 cause different behavior in test vs production, potentially hiding bugs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Debug: Format] [Information Disclosure] Does the Debug derivation expose sensitive internal state that could aid attackers in crafting exploits? (Low)
